Tucson nods in agreement.  

" Very well Leo Prime.  Quickstride will head =
the construction of the wind and hydro turbines.  Anyone who wishes to be o=
n that team, report to Quickstride for instruction.   As for Cheetor, I'm a=
fraid he has yet to be found.  Nightshift and Rattrap did all they could to=
 search for him, and I do believe Nightshift is severely damaged and will n=
eed immediate repairs."

He narrows his eyes.

"As for the mysterious enemy=
 controlling the dinosaurs, I will venture out to that location and I will =
show him what happens when you toil with something that you have no busines=
s toiling with.  I just can't sit here and expect all of you to risk your l=
ives out there..."

There is a bit of a pause as Tucson tries to fend off a=
 wave of weakness due to not taking ample time in the CR chamber.
He takes =
a deep breath and composes himself once again.
Quickstride looks to Tucson =
with concern as does Straight Shot.

" Wait a minute, Sir, no offense but y=
ou don't look like you're in the condition to do anything too strenuous.  I=
n fact there's still a really big dent in that arm of yours."

Straight Sho=
t nods.

"He's right Tucson, you really need ta slow down.  You took a pit =
of a beating from Hydras and anyone in your state, should seriously take ca=
re of themselves."

Tucson gives a gentle smile.

" I'll be fine, I assure =
you.  I've been through worse."

Straight Shot sits up and looks to Leo Pri=
me.

"He's not listening to me.  Maybe he'll listen to you.  He's already t=
aken more of his share of hard hits and if he thinks he's gonna go out ther=
e and do it all again, he's flipped a microchip or two. "

Tucson directs h=
is attention over to Straight Shot.

" I know, I know, you have every right=
 to not approve of my actions, but I failed this faction once, I will not f=
ail it again."

Straight Shot swallows hard as a tear trickles down her rig=
ht eye.

" No, what happened back then wasn't your fault.  None of it was. =
 Leo he's blaming himself for what happened to Rodimus and the others on hi=
mself.  He thinks that if he had just been a little more careful, he could'=
ve prevented Hydras from winning that battle.  But it wasn't his fault.  I =
was in his cab with him as an on board scout, looking out for possible ambu=
sh.  I saw someone in the skies far off behind us and I froze because he mo=
ved in really fast.  By the time Cyclonus moved in for the shot, I could ba=
rely say anything.  I was terrified.  Then that's when it happened.  I don'=
t remember too much after that but he was not the bot who failed the factio=
n, I was.  And there isn't a day that goes by without me being reminded of =
that costly error I made out on that battle field."

Tucson moves over to h=
is sister and puts a hand on her shoulder.

" No, that was never your fault=
.  It was mine.  I should have never asked you toventure out with me on suc=
h a dangerous mission."

He then looks to everyone.

" Times are about to g=
et difficult.  In order to win the battle ahead we have to work together, a=
nd we need to remain strong.  We will overcome as we have for centuries.  F=
reedom is the right for all sentient beings.  Now let us win it, for this p=
lanet, for us and for Primus."

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy=
. 

On Jul 13, 2011, at 2:11 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> w=
rote:

> > <OLD>

 help you but, before we
> > can do that, we have to fortify our energy res=
erves. We can not succeed on
> > what little we have. Quickstride is the ke=
y to providing us with the
> > resources we need to carry out a successful =
mission."
>

at something that
> AIRHAMMER, who had just came in as TUSCON and his team =
were returning,
> had handed to him.
>

RIME nodded, "Agreed. Energy is
> something that we will all need. Begin at=
 once."
> 
> He glanced back down at the Padd and continued speaking, "Airh=
ammer
> just gave me a quick report on his mission to pick up Nighshift." L=
EO
> looked back up at TUSCON, "Any word on Cheetor who is still missing?"
=
> 
> LEO PRIME glanced over at the green bot with the Predacon signature
> =
and then back at TUSCON, "And this bot here tells me that some
> criminals =
may have escaped from that ship that fell from the sky. Part
> of Airhammer=
's report shows an individual floating above a massive
> heard of Dinosaurs=
 of all types."
> 
> Lowering the Padd, LEO's face took on a stern cast, "W=
e may have more
> to deal with then the Unicronians, the Predacons and leav=
ing this
> world untouched." He puased, looked at his padd, the green robot=
 and
> then back at TUSCON, "There are criminals that will have to be
> rec=
overed."
